snippet: Hazleton, Pa., presents a test case of whether Republicans risk leaving behind white working-class voters for whom illegal immigration stirs visceral reactions.
abstract: Hazleton, Pa, gained national attention with its Illegal Immigration Relief Act in 2006, which was aimed to make it almost impossible for illegal immigrants to live there; local officials and many non-Hispanic residents say that they do not accept the reasoning of Republican leaders in Washington who say that giving legal status to illegal immigrants is overdue and a political imperative if Republicans are to win more Hispanic voters.
lead_paragraph: Hazleton, Pa., presents a test case of whether Republicans risk leaving behind white working-class voters for whom illegal immigration stirs visceral reactions.

headline.seo: New Attitude on Immigration Skips an Old Pennsylvania Coal Town
headline.main: New Attitude on Immigration Skips an Old Coal Town
headline.print_headline: New Attitude on Immigration Skips an Old Coal Town
